title: American Airlines' brand new Dreamliner plane damaged by hail storm
text:
American Airlines' brand new Dreamliner plane damaged by hail storm Last updated 09:48, July 30 2015 Eric Greer/AA.com 
American Airlines' brand new Dreamliner was damaged when it hit severe weather on a flight from Beijing to Texas. 
An American Airlines flight from Beijing to Dallas, Texas had to turn back when it flew into a hail storm. 
Flight 88, with 209 passengers and 13 crew on board, turned back just 44 minutes into its journey. 
The hail caused an impressive dent in the nose of the brand new Dreamliner and it wasn't long before the incident drew attention on social media. Choc aviaire et retour à Pékin d'un avion (B788/N805AN) de American Airlines ( #AA88 ) - http://t.co/Ug7VaoCm4g pic.twitter.com/9m34DuFEyW — Crash Aérien (@crashaerien) July 27, 2015 
A passenger on the flight told ABC News : "All we can tell you it was crazy. We were going sideways, up and down. We dropped a good few hundred feet, at least." American Airlines issued a statement to USA Today : "American Airlines Flight 88, a flight from Beijing Capital International Airport to Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport, returned to Beijing due to damage sustained by weather in flight. The Boeing 787, with 209 passengers and a crew of 13, is currently being evaluated by our maintenance team." 
Andrea Huguely, spokeswoman for the airline, said repair work was underway on the aircraft. 
Earlier this year, hail damaged a commercial Brazilian jetliner and cracked both its windshields. TAM Airlines flight JJ-3307 was climbing out of Rio de Janeiro when it was hit by lightning. Hail and turbulence caused severe damage to the radome of this A321 #TAM yesterday!!Emergency ldg! Via tráfico aéreo pic.twitter.com/VcQbsmKqnC
